a plank ab has length 4 m and mass 6 kg.  the plank rests in a horizontal position on 
two supports, one at b and one at c, where ac = 1.5 m.  a load of mass 15 kg is placed 
on the plank at the point x, as shown in figure 2, and the plank remains horizontal and in 
equilibrium.  the plank is modelled as a uniform rod and the load is modelled as a particle. 
the magnitude of the reaction on the plank at c is twice the magnitude of the reaction on 
the plank at b.

above a horizontal plane, as shown in figure 3.  the coefficient of friction between p and 
the table is 0.5.  particle p is released from rest with the string taut and slides along the 
table.
